bin.control

Class GamePlayController.PointerMoveAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.animation.AnimationTimer
      • bin.control.GamePlayController.PointerMoveAnimation
  • Enclosing class:
    GamePlayController

    private class GamePlayController.PointerMoveAnimation
extends javafx.animation.AnimationTimer
    This class implements abstract class AnimationTimer. Why I used this class? Firstly, I needed to create animation of game pointer's move. I tried to use TranslateTransition, but I found it bad when you need to switch pointers. And drawing on canvas was the best solution, but I needed to redraw scene every frame

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int goalX
      End position of pointer move on X axis.
      (package private) int goalY
      End position of pointer move on Y axis.
      (package private) int MOVE_STEP
      Speed (pixels/frame) of pointer movement.
      (package private) int startX
      Saved x position to draw line when moving GP (line start = this var, line end = GamePlayController.pointerX).
      (package private) int startY
      Saved y position to draw line when moving GP (line start = this var, line end = GamePlayController.pointerY).
      (package private) boolean stopped
      Variable-stopper for method start().

    • Field Detail

      • goalX

        int goalX
        End position of pointer move on X axis. By default it equals GamePlayController.pointerX, but in #PointerMoveAnimation(String) constructor} it's changed by move value.

      • goalY

        int goalY
        End position of pointer move on Y axis. By default it equals GamePlayController.pointerY, but in constructor it's changed by move value.

      • MOVE_STEP

        final int MOVE_STEP
        Speed (pixels/frame) of pointer movement. It can be only a multiple of 3 or 5, and also it can equal 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • stopped

        boolean stopped
        Variable-stopper for method start().
        See Also:
        stop(), start()

      • startX

        int startX
        Saved x position to draw line when moving GP (line start = this var, line end = GamePlayController.pointerX).

      • startY

        int startY
        Saved y position to draw line when moving GP (line start = this var, line end = GamePlayController.pointerY).

    • Constructor Detail

      • PointerMoveAnimation

        PointerMoveAnimation(java.lang.String keyText)
        Constructor is quite complicated. Firstly it sets GamePlayController.movingPointer to true - this says that we're moving pointer. And, secondly this part sets two variables: goalX and goalY.

        Note: if "goal cell" is filled animation will be stopped.

        Parameters:
        keyText - text of pressed key, used for recognizing direction.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(long now)
        This method is an implementation of AnimationTimer.handle(long). Here's all move animation logic:
        1. Changing position of pointer: if goalX is grater than GamePlayController.pointerX - last one increments, otherwise - decrements. Same this with goalY and GamePlayController.pointerY.
        2. Stopping animation: if reached end (pointerX == goalX && pointerY == goalY) - animation stops.
        Specified by:
        handle in class javafx.animation.AnimationTimer
        Parameters:
        now - time in nanoseconds (same as System.nanoTime(), but with some additions)

      • start

        public void start()
        Overrides method AnimationTimer.stop() because there're some calls of this method before starting animation. So, uses variable-stopper.
        Overrides:
        start in class javafx.animation.AnimationTimer

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Overrides method AnimationTimer.stop(). Why I have chosen to override? That's because of GamePlayController.movingPointer. This method is called many times, and I don't wanted to type such code: 
        
 movingPointer = false;
 stop();
 // return;
        Overrides:
        stop in class javafx.animation.AnimationTimer
